title: EB garamond - thinner version?
content:
Hello,

I am new to the fourm's so forgive me if i don't use the correct etiquette!

I am currently using EB garamond for my website - [www.anonymousretouch.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313160848/http:/www.anonymousretouch.com/ "www.anonymousretouch.com") However i am looking for something which is slightly thinner? can anyone advise of an alternative?

many thanks
author: Anonymous.

comments.content:
I’m assuming you mean for the main title, as you don’t want to go any lighter on the small stuff or you’ll risk unreadability. If that’s the case, consider oldstyle serif typefaces designed for large sizes:  
 [Garamond Premier Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313160848/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/garamond-premier/?refby=typographica)  
 [Arno Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313160848/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/arno/?refby=typographica)  
 [Cycles Thirtysix](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313160848/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stone/cycles/?refby=typographica)  
 [Lyon Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313160848/https:/commercialtype.com/typefaces/lyon/lyon_display)  
 [Quarto Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313160848/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/quarto/webfonts/quarto-light/)  
 [Big Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313160848/http:/www.webtype.com/font/big-caslon-fb-family/)  
 [Freight Big](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313160848/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/garagefonts/freight-big-pro/?refby=typographica) / [Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20150313160848/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/garagefonts/freight-disp-pro/?refby=typographica)
